description.narrative: Health: Public duty bearers at national, provincial and district levels are making evidence-based policy and budget decisions about health and nutrition services that benefit the most disadvantaged children and women.

sector.narrative: Child health policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Evidence generation and policy advocacy for immunization
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

title.narrative: Pakistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Pakistan: Reach Every District (RED)/Reach Every Community (REC) Strategy Evaluation Pakistan (2014-18)
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Health: Public duty bearers at national, provincial and district levels are making evidence-based policy and budget decisions about health and nutrition services that benefit the most disadvantaged children and women.

description.narrative: UNICEF advocated for evidence based policy and budget decisions using information obtained from the mapping of immunization resources in most union councils, urban slums profiling, and cold chain and HIV/AIDS related studies. Three provinces developed Costed Every Newborn Action Plans (ENAP), and cold chain optimization and deployment plans finalized. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: # of provinces and areas have developed newborn survival strategy and action plan
# of Provinces developed and implemented operational plans for the Reach Every District (RED)/Reach Every Union Council (REUC) approach in selected districts
Existence of Policy for Community Health Workers to provide antibiotics for pneumonia

actual.value: 2017:The BMGF funded Pneumonia & Diarrhoea Project of UNICEF supporting govt. has initiated: updating & - revision of in-service IMNCI guidelines in collaboration with WHO - Sindh's DHIS and LHW MIS updated/revised in line with global guidelines including IMNCI and GAPPD. - Updating of EMLs, MSDPs, pr

title.narrative: A comprehensive RMNCAH communication plan (incorporating malaria, pneumonia and diarrhoea, PMTCT, immunisation, polio and child development) is developed, budgeted and implemented

actual.value: 2017:This is work in progress. Though communication Strategies for HIV, MNCH, and Immunization are available but they are not integrated as a comprehensive RMNCAH Communication Plan, due to the vertical nature and funding of Programmes on HIV, MNCH, Family Planning & PHC and HIV. title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Health Management Information System generates periodic reports with data disaggregated by age and sex (for relevant indicators) at national and sub-national level

actual.value: 2017:Data Dashboard developed by Federal Ministry of National Health Services, regulation & coordination. DHIS was introduced in Pakistan in 2009. It is now being fully implemented in Punjab and KP with regular reports with disaggregated data by Sex & Age is being generated. The process of DHIS introduct

title.narrative: Existence of a Multi-Year Plan (MYP) for immunisation

actual.value: 2017:The Federal, Provincial/Areas EPI Programmes developed their PC 1s based on their respective cMYPs. These PC 1s are co-financed by WB credit and a MultiDonor Trust Fund
